metadata._comment: Static Isotropic Mode Configuration - 3 parameter optimization (D0, alpha, D_offset). Supports --plot-experimental-data and --plot-simulated-data for data visualization.
metadata.description: Static isotropic homodyne scattering analysis - simplified 3-parameter model
metadata.based_on: He et al. PNAS 2024 - Transport coefficient approach (static case)
metadata.shell_completion: Use argcomplete for shell completion (conda environments auto-enabled)

analyzer_parameters._comment: Core analysis parameters - static isotropic mode

temporal._dt_note: Time step between frames in seconds

geometry._gap_note: Gap in Angstroms (not critical for static isotropic)

initial_parameters._comment: Starting values for 3-parameter static isotropic optimization [D0, alpha, D_offset]

optimization_config._comment: Optimization configuration - angle filtering disabled for isotropic mode

angle_filtering._isotropic_note: Angle filtering disabled for isotropic analysis

classical_optimization._methods_note: Classical methods: Nelder-Mead (always available), Gurobi (if licensed). Robust methods are in separate robust_optimization section.

_usage_flags.--method classical: Runs ONLY traditional classical methods: Nelder-Mead, Gurobi (if available)
_usage_flags.--method robust: Runs ONLY the three Robust-* methods for noise resistance
_usage_flags.--method all: Runs all methods above (classical + robust) + MCMC for complete analysis

classical_optimization._gurobi_availability: Gurobi quadratic programming solver provides an alternative to Nelder-Mead using quadratic approximation of the chi-squared objective function. Requires Gurobi license and installation (pip install gurobipy).

Nelder-Mead._xatol_note: Realistic parameter tolerance for experimental data
Nelder-Mead._fatol_note: Practical chi-squared tolerance for noisy data
Nelder-Mead._adaptive_note: Adaptive step sizes essential for robust convergence

Gurobi._comment: ENHANCED: Now uses iterative Trust Region SQP instead of single-shot QP (fixes χ² convergence)
Gurobi._algorithm: Iterative trust region SQP optimization with quadratic approximation and adaptive radius
Gurobi._max_iterations_note: Fewer iterations needed for 3-parameter isotropic case
Gurobi._method_note: Gurobi solution method (2=barrier method recommended for QP)
Gurobi._time_limit_note: Shorter time limit for simple 3-parameter problem

_trust_region_settings._note: Trust region hyperparameters for enhanced optimization

Gurobi._usage_note: Gurobi uses quadratic approximation via finite differences. Best for smooth objective functions with bounds constraints.
Gurobi._advantages: Handles bounds constraints naturally, can be faster for well-conditioned problems
Gurobi._disadvantages: Requires license, uses quadratic approximation which may not capture all nonlinearity

classical_optimization._selection_strategy_note: How to choose best result when multiple methods are used: best_chi_squared, consensus, first_success

objective_function._type_note: Objective function type: 'standard' for min χ² or 'adaptive_target' for min (χ² - α·DOF)²

_type_options.adaptive_target: Adaptive target chi-squared to prevent overfitting

objective_function._adaptive_target_alpha_note: Target multiplier α for adaptive chi-squared (recommended range: 0.8-1.2)
objective_function._adaptive_target_description: When type='adaptive_target', minimizes (χ² - α·DOF)² where DOF = N_data - N_params
objective_function._adaptive_target_benefits: Prevents overfitting by targeting statistically reasonable chi-squared values

solver_settings._comment: Comprehensive solver configuration for CVXPY-based robust optimization

CLARABEL._description: Interior-point solver optimized for 3-parameter static isotropic fitting

SCS._description: Conic solver optimized for 3-parameter static problems

GUROBI._description: Commercial solver optimized for 3-parameter static problems

objective_function._type_note: Objective function type: 'standard' for min χ² or 'adaptive_target' for min (χ² - α·DOF)²

_type_options.adaptive_target: Adaptive target chi-squared to prevent overfitting

objective_function._adaptive_target_benefits: Prevents overfitting by targeting statistically reasonable chi-squared values in robust optimization

mcmc_sampling._comment: Isolated MCMC Backend Architecture - Static Isotropic Mode (3 parameters: D0, alpha, D_offset)

_backend_architecture.isolation: Complete separation of PyMC CPU and NumPyro GPU implementations
_backend_architecture.conflict_prevention: Eliminates PyTensor/JAX namespace conflicts through isolated execution
_backend_architecture.backend_selection: HOMODYNE_GPU_INTENT environment variable or command-based selection

mcmc_sampling._draws_note: Sufficient samples for 3-parameter static isotropic problems
mcmc_sampling._thin_note: No thinning needed for well-behaved static problems

cpu_backend._description: Isolated PyMC implementation - no JAX dependencies
cpu_backend._isolation: Pure PyMC environment, complete separation from NumPyro/JAX

gpu_backend._description: Isolated NumPyro/JAX implementation - no PyMC dependencies
gpu_backend._platform_support: Linux with CUDA preferred, intelligent CPU fallback
gpu_backend._isolation: Pure NumPyro/JAX environment, complete separation from PyMC/PyTensor

scaling_parameters._comment: Physical scaling for c2_fitted = c2_theory * contrast + offset

parameter_space._comment: Parameter bounds for 3-parameter static isotropic optimization

analysis_settings._static_mode_note: True for static analysis (only D0, alpha, D_offset)

chi_squared_calculation._scaling_note: Scaling optimization always enabled for proper chi-squared
chi_squared_calculation._adaptive_targeting_note: Adaptive chi-squared targeting is configured separately in optimization_config.classical_optimization.objective_function and optimization_config.robust_optimization.objective_function
chi_squared_calculation._variance_method_note: Options: irls_mad_robust (default), irls_optimized (50x faster), mad_robust, mad_optimized (10x faster)

performance_optimization._comment: Performance optimization settings for chi-squared and IRLS calculations
performance_optimization._variance_estimator_note: irls_optimized provides 50-100x speedup via JIT compilation and vectorization
performance_optimization._chi_calculator_note: vectorized_jit provides 20-50x speedup with memory pooling
performance_optimization._median_algorithm_note: quickselect provides 5-10x speedup over numpy median for small arrays

mad_robust_settings._min_variance_note: Minimum variance floor for MAD method to prevent numerical issues

irls_config._algorithm_note: IRLS with MAD: σ²ᵢ = (1.4826 × MAD)², damping: σ² = α·σ²_new + (1-α)·σ²_prev

performance_settings._comment: Performance settings optimized for 3-parameter static case

noise_model._note: False uses full forward model consistent with classical optimization

validation_rules._comment: Validation rules for static isotropic analysis

output_settings._output_structure: homodyne_analysis_results.json (main summary) saved to output directory root. Method-specific results saved to individual directories: classical/[method_name]/ and robust/[method_name]/ containing analysis_results_[method_name].json, parameters.json, fitted_data.npz (consolidated: c2_experimental, c2_fitted, residuals, parameters, uncertainties, chi_squared, phi_angles, t1, t2), and c2_heatmaps_[method_name].png. Summary files: all_classical_methods_summary.json and all_robust_methods_summary.json. MCMC: results saved to mcmc/ subdirectory with same fitted_data.npz structure.

plotting._comment: Plotting configuration for static isotropic mode

c2_heatmaps._method_specific_note: When multiple optimization methods are used (e.g., Nelder-Mead + Gurobi), separate heatmaps are generated for each method with method names in filenames

output._filename_template_note: Frame-aware plotting: includes start_frame, end_frame for data range identification, method name (e.g., Nelder-Mead, Gurobi), and timestamp
